basics.name: Camelia Lai
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020

courses: ICS 111 Intro to Computer Science I
ICS 211 Intro to Computer Science II
PHYS 151/151L College Physics I and lab

work.company: STAR Team at the University of Hawaii
work.summary: Maintaining the student registration databases for the STAR Registration system for the University of Hawaii.
Computer, network, and server maintainence and developing Microsoft Outlook applications
highlights: Developed project folder search and engineering project management add-ins for Microsoft Outlook
Helped with the development of a website for the Hawaii Space Grant Consortium robotics outreach program

volunteer.summary: Coaching the Kalani VEX Robotics team in the robot design process and programming

volunteer.organization: Hawaii Interdisciplinary Neuroscience and Technology (HINT) Lab at U.H. Manoa
volunteer.summary: Assisting with the setup and running various experiments
highlights: Eye-tracking study on how people interpret code

awards.title: Fred and Annie Chan Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Manoa, ICS Department

awards.title: NCWIT Aspirations in Computing Award
awards.awarder: National Center for Women in Information Technology (NCWIT)
awards.summary: This award is presented to girls who are very active in pursuing education in computing and inspiring others.

awards.title: NCWIT AspireIT Outreach Grant
awards.awarder: National Center for Women in Information Technology (NCWIT)
awards.summary: I recieved a $3,000 grant to start GTEC, my outreach program to teach and encourage girls get inspired and educated in STEM and computing.
